text: Vernon James "Vern" Ehlers (February 6, 1934 â€“ August 15, 2017) was the former U.S. Representative for , having served from 1993 until 2011. He was a member of the Republican Party. Ehlers was the first research physicist to be elected to Congress; he was later joined by Rush Holt, Jr. (D-NJ) and Bill Foster (D-IL). Ehlers served on the Kent County Board of Commissioners from 1975 to 1982. Ehlers served from 1983 to 1985 in the Michigan House of Representatives and then served from 1985 to 1993 in the Michigan Senate. Ehlers died on August 15, 2017 in Grand Rapids, Michigan of Alzheimer's disease at the age of 83. ==References== ==Other websites== * Vern Ehlers for U.S. Congress official campaign site * * Category:1934 births Category:2017 deaths Category:Deaths from Alzheimer's disease Category:Disease-related deaths in Michigan Category:United States representatives from Michigan Category:American physicists Category:Politicians from Minnesota Category:Scientists from Michigan Category:Politicians from Michigan Category:Republican Party (United States) politicians
